title: Authorizes alco-sensor portable testing of motor vehicle operators by Triborough bridge and tunnel authority officers
summary: Authorizes Triborough bridge and tunnel authority officers to administer alco-sensor screening tests to determine if a person has consumed alcohol when an accident has occurred on authority property; operator will be transported to intoxicated driver testing unit of NYC police department if operator of motor vehicle tests positive.

       Introduced  by  Sen.  KRUGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when

       AN ACT to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation  to  permitting
         Triborough  bridge  and  tunnel authority officers to administer alco-
         sensor tests in certain cases

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  1 of section 1194 of the vehicle and traffic
    2  law is amended by adding a new paragraph (c) to read as follows:
    3    (C) FIELD TESTING; TRIBOROUGH BRIDGE AND TUNNEL PROPERTY. EVERY PERSON
    4  OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE WHICH HAS BEEN INVOLVED IN AN  ACCIDENT  ON  A
    5  SITE OWNED, OPERATED, AND MAINTAINED BY THE TRIBOROUGH BRIDGE AND TUNNEL
    6  AUTHORITY SHALL, AT THE REQUEST OF A BRIDGE AND TUNNEL OFFICER, LIEUTEN-
    7  ANT,  OR  SERGEANT OF THE TRIBOROUGH BRIDGE AND TUNNEL AUTHORITY, SUBMIT
    8  TO AN ALCO-SENSOR TEST TO BE ADMINISTERED BY SUCH  OFFICER,  LIEUTENANT,
    9  OR  SERGEANT  WHERE  SUCH OFFICER, LIEUTENANT OR SERGEANT HAS REASONABLE
   10  CAUSE TO BELIEVE THAT SUCH PERSON HAS BEEN OPERATING A MOTOR VEHICLE  IN
   11  VIOLATION  OF  ANY  SUBDIVISION  OF SECTION ELEVEN HUNDRED NINETY-TWO OF
   12  THIS ARTICLE.  THIS TEST SHALL BE GIVEN WITH PORTABLE, HAND-HELD  EQUIP-
   13  MENT.  IF  SUCH  TEST INDICATES THAT SUCH OPERATOR HAS CONSUMED ALCOHOL,
   14  THE BRIDGE AND TUNNEL OFFICER, LIEUTENANT, OR SERGEANT OF THE TRIBOROUGH
   15  BRIDGE AND TUNNEL AUTHORITY SHALL TRANSPORT SUCH OPERATOR TO THE INTOXI-
   16  CATED DRIVER TESTING UNIT OF THE NEW YORK CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT FOR THE
   17  PURPOSE OF REQUIRING SUCH OPERATOR TO SUBMIT TO A CHEMICAL TEST  IN  THE
   18  MANNER SET FORTH IN SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS SECTION.
   19    S  2. This act shall take effect on the first of January next succeed-
   20  ing the date on which it shall have become a law.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2252

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the vehicle and traffic law, in relation to permitting
Triborough bridge and tunnel authority officers to administer
alco-sensor tests in certain cases

PURPOSE OF BILL:
To authorize peace officers of the
Triborough Bridge
and Tunnel Authority to administer breath screening tests when a
motor vehicle accident occurs on Authority property.

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
Amends Subdivision 1 of
Section 1194 of the
Vehicle and Traffic Law to require that every person operating a
motor vehicle which has been involved in a motor vehicle accident on
a site owned and operated by the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel
Authority shall, at the request of the various officers holding peace
officer status, submit to a breath screening test for the purpose of
determining if such person has consumed alcohol, when such officer
holding peace officer status has reasonable grounds to believe that
such person has been operating a motor vehicle in violation of any
subdivision of section eleven hundred ninety-two of the VTL. If the
screening test indicates that alcohol has been consumed, the officer
shall transfer custody of such person to a police officer for the
purposes of requiring such person to submit to a chemical test of the
person's blood, breath, urine, or saliva for the purpose of
determining whether such person was intoxicated.
The measure also amends Section 553 of the Public Authorities Law to
provide for the establishment of a training program to instruct
Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority Officers in the use of breath
screening equipment.

EFFECTS OF PRESENT LAW WHICH THIS BILL WOULD ALTER:
Currently only
police officers may administer a breath screening test.

JUSTIFICATION:
Subdivision 1(b) of Section 1194 of
the VTL authorizes
police officers to administer breath screening tests to any driver
involved in an accident or who has violated any provision of the VTL.
This measure will extend that authorization to the peace officers of
the Triborough Bridge and Tunnel Authority when an accident occurs on
Authority property. Many times when an accident occurs on a TBTA
bridge or in a TBTA tunnel the first law enforcement personnel on the
scene are the peace officers of the TBTA. Much valuable time often
passes before a police officer reaches the scene, and, in some other

cases, the accident may not necessitate the presence of a police
officer. Nevertheless, there may be sufficient significant
indications that one or more of the drivers involved evidence signs
of intoxication. It is imperative
that those peace officers on the scene have the authority to
administer breath tests in such cases, and, upon evidence of
intoxication, transfer custody of the suspect to a police officer for
further proceeding and testing.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
For state and local governments, none. The cost
will be part of the TBTA annual budget.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This bill shall take effect on January 1st of next year.
